result.execSummary:
The defendant Vershawnda L Pickett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 4 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date. 
Court ordered that the defendant's supervision be in the Mental Health Unit of the Probation Department.

miscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

Attend parenting classes.
All evaluations are to be completed first.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Court determined that the defendant is indigent and ordered that all costs and surcharges are waived except for the supervision fees, which cannot be waived.
Pay supervision fees.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vershawnda L Pickett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court.  Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub appeared after the case was called.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also in court, probation agent, Jacqueline Hein.
cab
Defendant has first met with her agent.
The court will not set anymore court reviews.  If issues arise, the agent is to contact the court.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.  Statement by both counsel and the defendant.
.
Sentencing proceeded.
  Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 4 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
-Court imposed   
- Serve 120 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Attend parenting classes.
- All evaluations are to be completed first.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with firearms.
- Court determined that the defendant is indigent and ordered that all costs and surcharges are waived except for the supervision fees, which cannot be waived.
- Pay supervision fees.
.
Court ordered that the defendant's supervision be in the Mental Health Unit of the Probation Department.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Justice Point Report.
cab

Case recalled, same appearances.
The defendant appeared in court at 10:00 a.m.
The court withdrew the warrant and reinstated the bail.  The court will add a condition to the bail.  Defendant is to be turned over to Justice Point.  She is to have drug and alcohol testing. Court ordered absolute sobriety.
Defense is asking for another sentencing date in Branch 36.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.c

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
THE CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE WAS UNABLE TO LOCATE THE FILE.  NO FILE IN COURT.
Defendant did not appear at 8:30.  The court issued a bench warrant and forfeited all bail on deposit. Defendant is remanded to judge.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Request for substitution: DENIED.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Sentencing Hearing. Defense counsel was previously on the record in branch 37, due to the lateness of the hour court adjourned the case for a sentencing hearing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Received & Filed, Request for Substitution of Judge. Defendant has previously entered plea in this matter. For reasons placed on the record the court DENIED the substitution. Case remains scheduled in branch 23 and will transfer Branch 36 as of August 1st.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Received & Filed, DPA Progress Report.  Discussion regarding defendant's progress.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the state revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Court ordered proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief. Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample. Case adjourned for sentencing to branch 23. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received & Filed, DPA Progress Report. Discussion regarding defendant's progress with terms of DPA. Court admonished defendant to comply with terms and complete ordered programming of the DPA. Case adjourned for further review hearing in branch 23.  Review hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received & Filed, DPA Progress Report. Discussion regarding defendant's progress completing DPA conditions. Court admonished the defendant to comply with and complete terms of DPA. Defense request for an early review date, GRANTED. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Review hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Eichenlaub NOT in court, unable to appear due to scheduling conflict. Defendant advised of next court date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case is adjourned due to court's calendar to branch 23 to 12/12/2014 at 1:30 pm for Review Hearing. Case remains set for Status Conference on 12/04/2014 at 10:00 am, attorney Eichenlaub's appearance is waived for Status date. ADA Schmidt advised.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 23.  Review hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Discussion and clarification regarding No Contact Order. No Contact Order continued.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Matthew J. Torbenson for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TMP dob 1/13 03 or anoth of her other children, unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved per the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Vershawnda L Pickett in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
